page.title: 15SUTTON CHURCH
page.content: There are two places of worship in Sutton, a Methodist Chapel and the Parish Church. The church dates back to medieval times. There have been several additions to the structure since and much restoration work has been carried out, one major item being the restoration of the roof in 1974. The church has a 60 foot flint tower and a peal of 3 bells. Work presently being carried out involves the overhaul of the organ and its removal to another part of the church. The Lady Chapel is also being rebuilt. An interesting feature of the pews is that all the carved heads on them are slightly different.
